messages.content: Step 1: Obtain Wali's Consent
In Islam, the bride's Wali (guardian) must consent to the marriage.
The Wali is typically the father, but can also be the next male guardian if the father is not present.
Do you have the Wali's consent?
Step 2: Attend a Marriage Preparation Programme (MPP)
MUIS recommends all couples attend an MPP, especially if you're under 21 or marrying for the first time.
The MPP helps equip you with relationship and communication skills.
Have you completed the MPP?
Step 3: Prepare Required Documents
Before applying, ensure you have the following:
Are your documents ready?
Step 4: Submit Your Application Online
Apply online via [marriage.gov.sg](https://www.marriage.gov.sg/muslim).

content: Create an account or log in via Singpass.
Complete the Muslim marriage application form.

messages.content: Have you submitted the application?
Step 5: Attend ROMM Interview
You’ll be assigned an interview at the Registry of Muslim Marriages (ROMM).
The groom, bride, Wali and witnesses must attend this session.
Have you booked your interview?
Step 6: Perform the Nikah (Solemnization)
Once approved, the solemnization (Nikah) can be held at ROMM, mosque, or an approved venue.
Make sure your Kadi or Naib Kadi is confirmed for the event.
Ready for solemnization?
Step 7: Congratulations!
You’ve completed all the steps for registering a Muslim marriage in Singapore.
Remember to collect your marriage certificate and attend any post-marriage follow-up if applicable.
